comments.author: mohit.kanwal@gmail.com
comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1) AppleWebKit/535.1 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/13.0.777.1 Safari/535.1
Build Identifier: Thundebird 3.1.10

Gmail announced the people pane next to their mail pane, and outlook already has this feature, it would be pretty funky if Thunderbird also had it, just like the two products have implemented it.

Visit this link for more details regarding Gmail's people pane. http://news.cnet.com/8301-17939_109-20066592-2.html?part=rss&subj=news&tag=2547-1_3-0-20

Reproducible: Always
comments.creator: mohit.kanwal@gmail.com

comments.text: I'm ok to implement this if someone comes with a valid UI mockup for me to implement and a decent API for contacts, and a whole revamp of our contacts infrastructure.
comments.author: jonathan.protzenko@gmail.com
comments.raw_text: I'm ok to implement this if someone comes with a valid UI mockup for me to implement and a decent API for contacts, and a whole revamp of our contacts infrastructure.
comments.creator: jonathan.protzenko@gmail.com

comments.author: mohit.kanwal@gmail.com
comments.text:
Hi protz, 

I think they revamped the Address book. http://breakingtheegg.tumblr.com/post/11614333654/new-address-book-mockup

So are they going to land it in? What's the bug # for that?
comments.creator: mohit.kanwal@gmail.com

comments.text:
(In reply to Mohit Kanwal [:redDragon] from comment #2)
> Hi protz, 
> 
> I think they revamped the Address book.
> http://breakingtheegg.tumblr.com/post/11614333654/new-address-book-mockup
> 
> So are they going to land it in? What's the bug # for that?

This is early discussions. Work as not started. To keep you updated read the weekly meeting notes at https://wiki.mozilla.org/Thunderbird/StatusMeetings .
